content.text: Several updates and fixes have been made to the ElizaOS project, focusing on plugin enhancements, bug fixes, and documentation improvements.

Key updates include the implementation of the Elevenlabs plugin, enhancements to the OmniFlix Network Integration Plugin, and the addition of environment variable configurations for the plugin system. Bug fixes address issues with client speech-to-text functionality and plugin installation during initialization.
Documentation updates clarify the differences between the eliza-starter and eliza repositories, ensuring users have clear guidance on their usage.

categories.title: Issues with ElizaOS Actions and Client Startup

content.text: There is an issue with the 'suppressInitialMessage' property in ElizaOS actions. Despite setting 'suppressInitialMessage: true' in a custom action, the initial message is still displayed, indicating a malfunction. The expected behavior is for the agent to only reply with the callback message, not with an initial message.

The ElizaOS client starts but encounters errors related to sqlite-vec extensions. The errors indicate that the sqlite-vec-linux-arm64 package might not be installed, preventing the loading of necessary extensions. As a result, the client opens in a browser, but no agents are available for selection.

categories.title: Swarm-in-a-Box for Community and Team Management

content.text: The Org is developing a 'swarm-in-a-box' solution to be shipped with version 2. This innovative tool consists of capable, interlocking agents designed to assist in managing communities or remote teams. Users can hire the teammates they desire, communicate with them using natural language, and provide feedback on their performance.
